Reviews.Title: “Very "Business" Convenient”
Reviews.Author: CNavarro25
Reviews.Content: Have been to this location a few times on business. The room's are roomy and perfect for the business traveler. The decor is good but a bit outdated. I am not a fan of its restaurants; the food is just average and a bit pricy. However, love the "Cafe" in the lobby level. It is very convenient for a quick bit either early morning or late night. The personnel is very, very friendly. There was an issue with the "hot" water in my room this time; temperatue will not go beyond "luke". However, the water at the sink's faucet was almost boiling!. Got spiders in the room (not good for an aracnophobic like me) so this is a sign that fumigation is either overdue or not existant. Recommend the place for its location/accessibility.

Reviews.Title: “Dreary, with a food problem”
Reviews.Author: Bravide
Reviews.Content: The food is vile, except breakfast which scrapes an 'OK' You are miles from the proper good hotel / restaurant district. The rooms are small and quite dark. I was booked in by my PA. If you're doing your own booking in Mexico City forget this one unless it is very cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel - Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Ruben V
Reviews.Content: A fair business hotel, big and anonymous. But the staff is really friendly and helpfull and their English is good. I had a King Bed Room, was very spacious with a half open bathroom. Good large television with DVD player and a PC available in the room. Internet WIFI is free of charge available all over the Hotel. The location of the hotel is really good, next to the WTC, enough shops and restaurants around and close to Insurgentes.

Reviews.Title: “No better than average”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0004
Reviews.Content: I too had the same experience as Kosmok reviewer. I had stayed previously in quite a nice room and my stay was fine. Second stay I was given a very small room that was very worn, stained carpet, safe broken and just not of the same standard. To credit the hotel after 1 night I asked to be moved and they did so and the room was much better. I am a gold card loyalty club member of this hotel chain and has specifically requested a room type in advance but this was not taken into account. If you want to be close to WTC then it's probably a good option. I do not and am not taking a chance again.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are created equal...”
Reviews.Author: KosmoK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, and the first time, I had a very nice room. Modern amenities, comfortable bed, etc. I was pleasantly surprised based on some other experiences I and my colleagues have had around Mexico City. My room during the second stay was a completely different story. Dirty carpet, stains everywhere, holes in the carpet, desk was old and paint was chipped. Overall, completely different quality room. very disappointing, and hard to believe the room quality for the same rate would be this different. I will not be returning to this property.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Sirish_21
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Crowne de Plaza for about 9 days on my first trip to Mexico City. The staff is very helpful. The best part is that most of the staff speaks english so its easy for you to communicate if you don't speak spanish. One thing which was lacking was choice of vegetarian food since I am a vegetarian. But whatever is their to offer is good. Also the hotel is located in a very good neighbourhood with walking distance to Starbucks coffee and World Trade Center. This makes it convinient for you to explore the city with close viscinity to restaurants, convinient stores, bakeries and malls. Also the concierge would help you with taxi reservations and even the popular micro-buses and metro buses can be hailed just outside the hotel premises. You also have a choice of the restaurants which hotel has, though I didn't get time to try it but with the hustle bustle around I am sure its worth a try. Also they have a desktop with multiple services provided which helps you spend time just incase you are not in a mood to explore the place. May be just listen to some music. Have a mini bar (on request) and a coffee machine in the rooms so thats one advantage if you plan to work late night. Though their room service with variety of things on list is always available.

Reviews.Title: “Solid option very close to World Trade Center”
Reviews.Author: jloudercp
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza is a large hotel, right next to the Holiday Inn and behind WTC. Overall it was fine, although there was a problem with some holes in the bathtub and plaster coming through the wall. Also some issues with wireless internet. A computer is provided within the room, but very old and slow so I recommend bringing your own. Service is good and it is a busy place because of many business conferences. Currently there is a lot of construction taking place on this street and areas around it so there is a lot of dust, noise and difficulty navigating these streets. Not a peaceful location, although there are plenty of restaurants and amenities within walking distance. The spa leaves something to be desired, there is no pool, and gym is very minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Most welcoming”
Reviews.Author: YR R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel located close to the WTC - very helpful staff all of whom speak perfect English. Corner room on the 8th floor was very nice - whirlpool bath (which we'd never normally use was put into action due to sore feet & achy knees from pounding the pavements!) was most welcome. The only negative thing I can think of is the lighting in the room at night is appaulling ! Hardly any fixtures & low wattage bulbs. The concierge did recommend 2 good restaurants, La Sabor del Tiempo & Cantina de los Remedios, which are a short walk away. We've not always had success with what a concierge recommends - but both of these were great.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarrySandell
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Crowne Plaza that is near the Mexico City World Trade Centre conference centre - I think there are at least two others in the city. This is a good business-class hotel, with comfortable rooms (good double-glazing so there is minimal street noise at least on the 8th floor where I was), and wifi internet in the rooms (but quite slow on the 8th floor so skype would only support speech, not video). Good-sized bathroom with shower and separate jacuzzi bathtub. My room had a good-sized desk for work, effective aircon and a good mini-bar and coffee-making facilities (nice filter coffee) but Brits note - no way to make tea (just as well I took a travel kettle and powdered milk as well as teabags). There's an excellent buffet breakfast with a huge variety of dishes to choose from. The hotel bar is comfortable and reasonably-priced. The food in the restaurants in the evenings is OK but not brilliant: there is one which does Italian and Mexican food (and also "fusion" eg Mexican pizza!) and another (the one where breakfast is served) which has a very limited menu form some reason. Food and drink prices are moderate by European standards - eg Â£1.50 for a local beer (Indio is nice - a dark lager), Â£10 for a huge steak, Â£5 for pasta. There's quite a good Italian restaurant at the far end of Maricopa, the road opposite the hotel front entrance, called La Strega which looks fancy but is still reasonably priced at Â£7 for a fairly good pasta.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate but no hotel shuttle from airport”
Reviews.Author: NCtravelz
Reviews.Content: I picked this Holiday Inn because I got an amazing deal with points from Holidayinn.com and they advertised a free shuttle from the airport. When I got to the airport I found out that the free shuttle is only from the hotel to the airport and not the other way around. The hotel was quite pretty but had a few minor inconveniences. I waited at a desk in the lobby for a while before I was informed that as a priority member I needed to check in upstairs. They should have told me this before I waited for an agent and started the process downstairs. The bellman was very nice and offered to look into a bus schedule for me the next day and said he'd be right back with it. He never returned. The room service was ok. The bathroom was lovely but I never found any soap. The hotel is very nice but only convenient to the WTC. I would stay here again only if I had an overnight in DF and got the same great deal (75% discount). If I'm in town for longer, I much prefer to stay at the Holiday Inn at the zocalo.

Reviews.Title: “Great quick buisness trip”
Reviews.Author: nellymty
Reviews.Content: I went just for one night to Mexico City to attend a meeting and since my arrival to the hotel the staff was very friendly and willing to satisfy all my needs. The room was very spacious and the bed amazing. The bathroom was very nice with a separate bathtub and shower. The service was good but the hair dryer in the bathroom was not working and I asked for another one and they were really nice and quick in delivering it to my room. Even I just stayed for the night I got the chance to sleep well and recover from the trip and the meeting. They have fresh and coffee, so if you are in a hurry as I was I just grab a coffee, did a express check out at 7 and head to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel if you are doing business at the WTC”
Reviews.Author: AZSailor12
Reviews.Content: Overall the service was excellent everywhere- bell stand, front desk, bar and restaurants and maids. The only exception was that the front desk didn't recognize me for top level Priority Club membership, something that pretty much every IC hotel does. However, my room was very nice: shower and jacuzzi bath, very comfortable bed, very clean and relatively quiet. The breakfast buffet was excellent, though expensive. I thought the pizza might be good, given the gas/brick pizza oven, but it was hardly edible. The more traditional Mexico dinner items were much better. Given the many excellent restaurants nearby, I would go explore if you have the time. I will definitely stay here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, slept well”
Reviews.Author: Mamasita-sota
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a room here (on December 26, 2010) with a jacuzzi tub and enjoyed it! The bed was very comfortable. We stayed on the 7th floor and had a view of the World Trade Center. We ate at Bellini's (revolving restaurant) located at the top of the World Trade Center and that was very nice. There is no pool at this hotel. They said that they were remodeling the upper floors and perhaps by now, there are more updates to the rooms. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: ajnuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel on a short business trip, and it was an excellent choice. The staff was attentive and friendly. I had no problems during my stay. The room was modern, clean, and functional. I had a nice view from the 9th floor. I had the breakfast buffet in the restaurant downstairs, and it was good. I also had a dinner in the restaurant, which was OK, but nothing special. I did not bring a car, so I can't comment on the parking garage under the hotel. My only complaint is the home web page for the hotel listed a free airport shuttle as an amenity when I booked my stay. When I asked about the shuttle to the airport, I was told it cost 220 pesos, and the free shuttle statement has since disappeared from their web site.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Mexico City (Dakota)”
Reviews.Author: fxcarden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK for business travel, located near the world trade center. While the hotel is clean, and in good shape, I found a few things that could have made the experience better. First, hot water in the shower was hit and miss. Not sure why, but this was a problem. Second, my room was on the 19th floor, and it was very noisy. My room was the first one off the elevators, and there is also a lounge there with a TV blasting. Even when they shut the TV off, the cleaning people make quite the racket until very late. I think someone should address this, and perhaps turn off the elevator bells during the night time hours. Other than that, the food at the restaurants was good, the atmosphere was also good, and the staff always had a smile on their face, and were extremely attentive. All in all, if I ever go back there I would not hesitate booking this hotel, as long as I get a different room.

Reviews.Title: “So good I'm afraid to share ...”
Reviews.Author: marlecz
Reviews.Content: Some 8 years ago I "landed" for first time in that property; the interesting fact is that today the Hotel keeps the same characteristics that give us, business travelers the trusts to keep going when predictability is so important. Very good location for moving into different places out of there & providing a swift ride to the airport make the location very desirable. Walking distance from hundred of restaurants & all kind of shops. The property also offers the options to stay at the Holiday Inn Express, just next door & connected to the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but definitely not a "feel good" hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfing10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times in 2 months and had a variety of rooms, some large, some small, some close to elevators and one a long hike away! Had a pasta for lunch and it was fair then saw someone eat the same dish in the bar and it was very differently presented. Breakfast buffet is good with lots of choices and good wait staff. Bar / lobby is when the atmosphere gets to me. Seems like the lobby of a shopping mall. It is worse when there are crews filming telenovelas in and around the lobby. close to WTC and Insurgentes Sur.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Mexico world trade center. Hotel and staff are both very good. Even when I did not like Mexico city mainly because of the crowds, this hotel made the stay kind of relaxing. Food was excellent at the restaurant and business rooms were also good. Staff was excellent and so was the room service. We booked an excursion to the pyramids and everything went very good. The bad part was that we HAD to buy some things from the sellers in the pyramids just to get rid of them. Very good sales technique xD.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: doctor1995
Reviews.Content: Good business-oriented hotel near WTC. Check-in and check-out was fast. Staff was friendly. Standard rooms aren't very big. Underground parking costs 90 m$ per day (had to ask consierge to pay parking ticket) . Internet was free (via WI-FI and in-room terminal), speed was good. Didn't try breakfast. Stayed on prioritybreaks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: trinzeon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Crowne Plaza on the 9th floor in one of the executive rooms. The hotel was nice enough. Staff friendly and helpful. Check-in was a bit slow but average for Mexico. The in-room amenities were good. The fitness center was not much to speak of and there is no pool, which is a bummer. Very good wireless internet service, which was free. The location is good if you have business in the immediate area or at UNAM. Would not recommend to tourists wishing to visit Mexico City. The overall ambience is clean and fairly modern. I found the food to be a bit lagging. I tried the Mexican/Italian restaurant but found the Mexican food menu to be extremely limited and somewhat disappointing. The executive lounge offerings for breakfast were adequate but nothing special. The lounge itself was pretty nice, though you have to walk through it to get to your room. Nearby there are a few good restaurants and the World Trade Center has a touristic ar/restaurant that is the highest point in Mexico city for eating and drinking. There is a very nice park up the main road towards the University, but it is about a 30 minute walk. Overall, I would definitely stay again since it is located close to my business and clients.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwibeandip
Reviews.Content: While in Mexico City on business, a distributor booked this hotel for me. I was very pleased with the choice. Staff was extremely friendly and courteous. Almost everyone spoke English. The doormen were very helpful and got us safe, clean cabs. (if you want to ride in a nice, newer car, and have a very professional looking driver, you can get the more expensive cabs. OR they have the MUCH cheaper cabs that are still safe and good guys. Just specifiy that you want the cheaper ones.) The breakfast buffet was excellent. Lots of variety and great food and fantastic fruit and juice! Room service was good food and ecellent service. I had laundry done and was perfectly happy. The workout room was alright, and they offered some basic spa services. But i didn't use either. The hotel seemed to be in a pretty good location. Several good restaurants nearby, including the wonderful Bellini rotating restaurant at the top of the World Trade Center. Fantastic! I had a basic single room, which i was happy with even though it was very tiny. The bed was comfortable and the internet didn't have any problems. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Always very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDonall
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at teh Crowne Plaza 3 times and it has to be one of my favourite Business class hotels anywhere. It is comfortable and ideally located if you are doing business at the WTC or Insurgentes etc. Rooms are well appointed with internet, great beds and jacuzzi baths! Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfasts are very good. The Italian restaurant is good but a bit lacking in atmosphere. I recommend trying the revolving restaurant on the top floor of the WTC across the road for amazing views and good food. I look forward to going back to the Crowne Plaza soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sggypsy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business. The room was very spacious with comfortable bed and bathroom. I enjoyed the whirlpool tub and great shower. The free internet service was excellent both on the provided terminal and my personal laptop. Room service was timely and the food was good. There were a few English speaking TV stations which were sufficient for my late night relax to sleep. The bellman booked a tour and took good care of all arrangements. Service at the desk was excellent as well. I found everyone friendly and helpful. It isn't in a particulary pretty area but it is safe and there were some local restaurants and shops around the hotel in easy walking distance. My only complaint was the in-room free coffee service...there was no coffee. To be fair I could never remember to ask for the coffee until the early morning when I wanted it. I am sure they would have provided coffee if I had asked. There was free coffee in the lobby and the coffee with room service was hot and good.

Reviews.Title: “Good facility, terrible services”
Reviews.Author: SpanishManInMexico
Reviews.Content: Good points: Hotel is just brand new. Rooms are modern and confortable. Internet is free either through the terminals fitted in every room or wifi. It worked either way for me. Italian Restaurant and Lobby Bar were OK. Anyway, bath tubs should be maintained more often and air conditioning noisy. Bad points: - Terrible service: To begin with, breakfast was horrible. I was travelling "European Plan" so breakfast was incluided. My wife and me were taken by the waiter to a dirty table and the first thing he asked was for the breakfast coupons (that were not delivered at reception at arrival anyway) in a very rude manner. I told him to shut up and arrange the table for my wife and me, before asking me for payment, which he duly did. The lady in charge of reservations was extremely rude to us when we asked her to review ours, as we had kind of difficult scheduled. I had to call my travel agency IN SPAIN to help the reception lady to find ouyr reservations in HER system. I was waken up by a funny lady at midnight just to ask if dinner charges could be charged to my credit card. Next morning at 8:00 a.m, a knock on the door to ask me if I was leaving the hotel that morning. Half an hour afterwards I got a phone call from reception desk, asking the same thing again. To hot things up a little bit, my mother ask, in the executive floor, to heat up his milk for breakfast. The waiter just did not care about her. By the way, breakfast at executive floor was really poor, compared with some other Crowne Plaza Hotels I have stayed in. After all this stuff, we asked for an interview with the Hotel Manager, a very nice man to be honest, who apologized for everything but finally did nothing. He told my wife to indentify the rude waiter of the first day and tell him inmediatly "I will sack him", he said, "but I will not tell him who was the client who complained" Well, after identifying the waiter, he (the waiter) came back to us apologizing bitterly.... - Parking Parking was not free and expensive, by Mexican standards, but it was a mess to pay the bill every morning, as ATM had an unconsistent behaviour and belly boys did this job whenever the felt it appropiate. All in all, the hotel has a lot of potential, but they have a very serious management problem. Normally, service in Mexico is EXCELLENT by any standard, and it was not the case. I have stayed recently at Crowne Plaza Monterrey Hotel and the experience was amazing. This hotel does not deserve AT ALL the Crowne Plaza tag.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: travman1031
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wedding in Feb. 2007 in Mexico City and we used this hotel for out-of-town guests and for our own use before leaving for our honeymoon. We had a total of about 10 rooms and nobody had any complaints. The hotel is in a convenient and safe location of Mexico City. All rooms had computer monitors with free internet access, which kept everyone in touch with home by e-mail. The rooms also had jacuzzi tubs with seperate showers. The service was above average compared to other hotels in Mexico, and much better than most hotels in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Biz_Traveller Latin America
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and have always been impressed by the quality of the rooms (new, stylish, great bathroom), but the quality of the service has been consistantly terrible. The check-in and bar staff are truly horrendous, and I think that the hotel must have made it a priority to employ such sullen, unresponsive personnel as generally in Mexico the service is great. This is certainly a management problem (they just don't care), and when I asked to speak to ANYONE from management, there was no one available! Oh, and if you want a late check-out of more than 2 hours, they will charge you A FULL EXTRA DAY. Unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, bad service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While this hotel has some large rooms, it also has tiny uncomfortable rooms. If you decide to stay at this hotel check your room before you accept to stay in it. I was assigned room 1432. It is very small and uncomfortable. To be able to walk accross te room you need to move the chair against a wall. It is impossible to keep the chair in front of the desk and move freely accross the room. In addition, the bathroom is so small that if you keep the door open it blocks access to the toilet. The restaurant has good food, but the service sucks. I had dinner with a group of ten and the waiter got all the orders mixed up. He forgot to place my order at the same time he placed all orders and finally presented a raw fish when everyone in my group was ready to leave. I don'recommend this hotel unless you like small rooms and bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Decker1
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at the Crowne Plaza Hotel de Mexico. This is a brand new hotel right down the street from the World Trade Center. Rooms were clean, spacious and I found all the amenities great, including the wall mounted panel for control of lights, housekeeping call, DND etc. The bed was one of the more comfortable beds I have been in at a hotel. Bathroom was good size with a small jacuzzi tub and stand up shower. As far as the food, I did not do room service, as they have an excellent Italian restaurant on the premises. We had a large party, and all 3 nights we chose to return there for dinner. Great wine, and great food, especially the home made pasta dishes. Yes the service is a little slow, but that is typical. Staff was very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Hotel de Mexico
HotelInfo.Address: Dakota #95 | Col. Napoles, Mexico City 03810, Mexico
